description_txt: stated on June 29, 2011 in a press conference:
quote_txt: "If you're a … wealthy CEO or a … hedge fund manager in America right now, your taxes are … lower than they've been since the 1950s."

description_txt: stated on June 27, 2011 in several speeches and interviews:
quote_txt: Says President Barack Obama said that if he doesn’t turn the economy around after three years in office, he’ll be a one-term president.

description_txt: stated on June 24, 2011 in a press conference:
quote_txt: "The American people don't want us to raise taxes."

description_txt: stated on June 22, 2011 in a speech before the Atlanta Press Club:
quote_txt: "On the day of the New Hampshire primary in 1980, the top 13 people of Ronald Reagan’s staff quit."

description_txt: stated on June 11, 2011 in a Texas Capitol rally.:
quote_txt: Says states that passed anti-illegal-immigrant legislation also had few Hispanic legislators.

description_txt: stated on April 14, 2011 in an interview on Fox News:
quote_txt: "For every dollar we invest in Head Start, we get $5 to $7 back into our economy."

description_txt: stated on May 24, 2011 in an opinion piece:
quote_txt: "The top 1 percent of income earners pay 40 percent of all state income taxes, and those at the bottom pay little or nothing."

description_txt: stated on June 26, 2011 in an interview on ABC's "This Week with Christiane Amanpour":
quote_txt: "We do not want to raise anybody's tax rates. That's never been on the table."

description_txt: stated on June 24, 2011 in an interview:
quote_txt: On pay for fired Milwaukee police officers

description_txt: stated on June 22, 2011 in a redistricting meeting in Panama City:
quote_txt: "There is no $30 million pot of money" for redistricting issues, including defending redistricting lawsuits. "Your tax dollars are not being spent on anything like that."

description_txt: stated on June 2, 2011 in a fundraising appeal.:
quote_txt: Gov. Bob McDonnell launched a "raid on public education to pay for roads."

description_txt: stated on June 26, 2011 in an interview on CNN's "State of the Union with Candy Crowley":
quote_txt: "We've got more revenue than we ever have."

description_txt: stated on June 8, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: "Rep. Jim Renacci’s plan to end Medicare also puts nursing home care for 3,000 seniors in the district in immediate jeopardy."

description_txt: stated on June 16, 2011 in a broadcast:
quote_txt: "(Birmingham, Ala.) is the cradle of the civil rights movement."

description_txt: stated on June 15, 2011 in an interview on ABC's "Top Line":
quote_txt: "Since 2004, there have been some 1,300 attacks (on rail targets). Four thousand people have died. Thousands of injuries."

description_txt: stated on June 20, 2011 in a meeting of the Rhode Island Public Transit Authority board :
quote_txt: "We are one of the most expensive [bus] rides in New England."

description_txt: stated on June 26, 2011 in CBS' Face the Nation:
quote_txt: "Under Barack Obama the last two years, the number of federal limousines for bureaucrats has increased 73 percent."

description_txt: stated on June 1, 2011 in an interview on WKXL-AM in Concord, N.H.:
quote_txt: "If you threw a barbecue yesterday for the Memorial weekend, it was 29 percent more expensive than last year because Barack Obama's policies have led to groceries going up 29 percent."

description_txt: stated on June 26, 2011 in an interview on CBS's "Face the Nation":
quote_txt: "The president released all of the oil from the Strategic Oil Reserve."

description_txt: stated on June 20, 2011 in a Fox News interview:
quote_txt: In the first 24 to 36 hours of the operation in Libya, "you saw $115 million go downrange because a Tomahawk cruise missile is a little over $1 million each."

description_txt: stated on June 22, 2011 in an online chat with the "Washington Post":
quote_txt: "Hispanic unemployment has been ticking down from an all-time high of 13.9 percent because of the policies we’ve implemented."

description_txt: stated on June 20, 2011 in a campaign fund-raising letter:
quote_txt: There is a Republican "plan to end Medicare."

description_txt: stated on June 6, 2011 in a web video.:
quote_txt: Virginia spends $400,000 on abstinence programs while losing $2.5 million in federal funds due to Gov. Bob McDonnell’s "political agenda."

description_txt: stated on June 16, 2011 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: A "substantial number" of probationers participating in a pilot project to ease the farm labor shortage are able to "finish the work."

description_txt: stated on May 24, 2011 in a press release:
quote_txt: "The state’s tax burden has, according to census figures released today, cost our state another 190,000 residents in 2009."

description_txt: stated on June 14, 2011 in a speech on the floor of the House of Representatives:
quote_txt: The WIC program "is an incredibly cost effective program, serving nearly 10 million Americans each year and costing less than $100 per person. In my district, more than 18 percent of residents suffer from food insecurity and depend on WIC to make ends meet."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • June 26, 2011

description_txt: stated on June 14, 2011 in a cameo interview.:
quote_txt: "Since June 2009, about 48 percent of all the jobs created in America were in Texas."

description_txt: stated on June 18, 2011 in a campaign mailer.:
quote_txt: "Under Randi Shade," Austin has "had the highest cost of living of any large Texas city."

description_txt: stated on June 14, 2011 in an interview with Gov. Chris Christie on "Piers Morgan Tonight":
quote_txt: Says Gov. Chris Christie’s "poll ratings have been going up."

description_txt: stated on June 15, 2011 in a press release:
quote_txt: Says Rick Perry of Texas was "the governor who relied most on stimulus funds to close his state’s budget deficit in 2010."
